title: Family IDs teen killed in Desire Street double shooting
content:
Rayshawn Boullt has been identified by family as the 15-year-old killed in a double shooting that left a 13-year-old boy wounded Saturday night (Jan. 21) on Desire Street.
Boullt's aunt, Lawanda Tobias, said Boullt had been living with her in Baton Rouge up until about a month and a half ago, when he ran away to live with his sister in New Orleans. She said her nephew is not related to another of the city's murder victims, Terence Boullt, who was shot and killed Sunday night at LaSalle and Amelia streets.
Terence Boullt died of a gunshot wound Sunday night (Jan. 22) at the corner of LaSalle and Amelia streets in the Milan area Uptown, authorities said.
Authorities found Rayshawn Boullt about 6 p.m. Saturday, lying on the sidewalk in the 2100 block of Desire Street. A 13-year-old boy, whom Tobias said was her nephew's friend, was shot in the arm. New Orleans police said the boy arrived by private vehicle to an area hospital.
